blender_visualize_network module¶

blender_visualize_network.add_camera(x_max, y_max, z_max, render_range)¶
blender_visualize_network.add_light(x_max, y_max, z_max)¶
blender_visualize_network.add_plane()¶
blender_visualize_network.append_with_zeros(num_of_digits, iteration)¶
Will give the file-name of the current iteration. The file will be named to enable natrual sorting even in

a windows OS. For instance, if total number of digits == 3 and current iteration is 7 the file-name will be “007”

Parameters

  • num_of_digits – (int) Total number of needed digits in the file-naming

  • iteration – (int) Current iteration

Return appended_name

(str) File name

blender_visualize_network.clean_blender()¶
blender_visualize_network.color_fader(c1, c2, mix=0)¶
Parameters

  • c1 –

  • c2 –

  • mix –

Returns

blender_visualize_network.create_gif()¶
Will fetch all *.png files located under the temp folder and creates an animated gif to visualize the

training sequence.

Returns

blender_visualize_network.determine_number_of_digits(num_of_iterations)¶
Determines the number of digits needed in the image naming to hold all iterations. This is used to get the

images naturally sorted based on name even in a windows file-explorer.

Parameters

num_of_iterations – (int) Total number of iterations

Return num_of_digits

(int) Total number of needed digits in the file-naming
